template.template: Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps
template.name: Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps

item.name: WLC Max Number Of APs Supported
Number of network interfaces
item.description: The number of network interfaces (regardless of their current state) present on this system.

item.name: Device contact details
item.description: The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device description
item.description: A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Device location
item.description: The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device name
item.description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device uptime
item.description: The time since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item_prototype.name: $1 Ap If No Of Users 2.4 GHz
item_prototype.description: No of Users associated with this radio.

item_prototype.name: $1 Ap If No Of Users 5 GHz
item_prototype.description: No of Users associated with this radio.

item_prototype.name: $1 AP If Phy Channel Number 2.4 GHz
item_prototype.description: Current channel number of the AP Interface. Channel numbers will be from 1 to 14 for 802.11b interface type. Channel numbers will be from 34 to 169 for 802.11a interface type.

item_prototype.name: $1 AP If Phy Channel Number 5 GHz
item_prototype.description: Current channel number of the AP Interface. Channel numbers will be from 1 to 14 for 802.11b interface type. Channel numbers will be from 34 to 169 for 802.11a interface type.

item_prototype.name: $1 AP Ip Address
item_prototype.description: Clients (Mobile Stations)

item.host: Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps
Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps

item_prototype.name: $1 - No Of Users Currently Associated
item_prototype.description: "No of Mobile Stations currently associated with the WLAN."

graph_prototype.name: WiFi ESSID ({#SNMPVALUE}) num. of users connected

item.host: Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps

discovery_rule.name: WLC Clients data
discovery_rule.description: 802.11 MAC and IP Addresses of the Mobile Station.

item_prototype.name: Client APMac [{#STAIP} | {#STAMAC}]
item_prototype.description:
Need value_mapping like this:
AP MAC -> NAME 00 17 0F 21 5F 40 -> SPB_KAM_112-1 00 25 83 E8 BE 10 -> SPB_KAM_112-2

item_prototype.name: Client RxSpeed [{#STAIP} | {#STAMAC}]
item_prototype.description: Bytes received from Mobile Station

item_prototype.name: Client TxSpeed [{#STAIP} | {#STAMAC}]
item_prototype.description: Bytes sent to Mobile Station

item_prototype.name: Client Errors [{#STAIP} | {#STAMAC}]
item_prototype.description: Average PolicyErrors for the Mobile Station.

item_prototype.name: Client RSSI [{#STAIP} | {#STAMAC}]
item_prototype.description: Average packet RSSI for the Mobile Station.

item_prototype.name: Client Pkts RX [{#STAIP} | {#STAMAC}]
item_prototype.description: Average Rx pkts for the Mobile Station.

item_prototype.name: Client SNR [{#STAIP} | {#STAMAC}]
item_prototype.description: Average SNR for the Mobile Station.

item_prototype.name: Client Pkts TX [{#STAIP} | {#STAMAC}]
item_prototype.description: Average Tx pkts for the Mobile Station.

item.host: Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps
Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps
Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps
Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps
Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps
Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps
Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps

item_prototype.name: Client username [{#STAUSIP} | {#STAUSMAC} | {#STAUSNAME}]
item_prototype.description: MAC-IP-Username binding

discovery_rule.name: WLC Interfaces data
discovery_rule.description:
This discovery rule find interfaces what match this criteria:
{#IFADMSTATUS} 1 {#IFNAME} ^(Fa.*|Gi.*)$

item_prototype.name: Bytes RX on {#IFNAME}
item_prototype.description: The number of octets in valid MAC frames received on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: Bytes TX on {#IFNAME}
item_prototype.description: The number of octets transmitted in MAC frames on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: Errors RX on {#IFNAME}
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

item_prototype.name: Pkts RX on {#IFNAME}
item_prototype.description: pps rate.

item_prototype.name: Errors TX on {#IFNAME}
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that could not be transmitted because of errors.

item_prototype.name: Pkts TX on {#IFNAME}
item_prototype.description: pps rate.

item.host: Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps
Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps
Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps
Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps
Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps
Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps

trigger.expression: {Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps:snmptrap.fallback.regexp(SNMPv2-MIB::authenticationFailure)} and {Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps:snmptrap.fallback.nodata(1h)}=0
trigger.name: Login Auth Error on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps:icmpping.nodata(15m)}=1
trigger.name: No ICMP data from {HOST.NAME}

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME} is DOWN
dependency.expression: {Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps:icmpping.max(#3)}=0

trigger.expression: ({Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps:agentFreeMemory.last()}/{Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps:agentTotalMemory.last()})<0.20
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - Free memory too low

trigger.expression: {Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps:sysUpTime.last(0)}<600
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has been restarted

trigger.expression: {Basic Cisco WLC with icmp and traps:icmpping.max(#3)}=0
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} is DOWN
